channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CT

item.title: Report E-2025040001
item.description:
Report E-2025040001

Identified by scraper @ 2025-04-20T00:57:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-27
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 27, 2025, two (2) 50-pound bags of UN1477 were punctured and released approximately two (2) cups of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Services, Inc. (ESI) to remediate the site. The crew utilized cleaners, absorbents, and hand tools to clear the impacted floor. All impacted materials and the damaged bags were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.
